        <span key="d81144a5cb00427f95335018d372fe8c"><span offset-key="d81144a5cb00427f95335018d372fe8c:0">​</span></span><a href="https://bgoonz42.gitbook.io/datastructures-in-pytho/misc/untitled/pythons-default-argument-values-and-lists" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0a975b3484524eaaba464a39bb9b1daa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-9138_262-9139-240__"><span data-key="23140595c29d41f99427fa54b8f61222"><span data-offset-key="23140595c29d41f99427fa54b8f61222:0">Python's Default Argument Values and Lists</span></span></span></a><span key="8db3dc9051834b3cbcca3392a6c103ce"><span offset-key="8db3dc9051834b3cbcca3392a6c103ce:0">​</span></span>

        <span key="09d142e63b3147b3a21a9d5e079f30cd"><span offset-key="09d142e63b3147b3a21a9d5e079f30cd:0">​</span></span>

<span key="27d059ae07bb4a198c5773d0b91be31b"><span offset-key="27d059ae07bb4a198c5773d0b91be31b:0">​</span></span><span slate-void="true" key="89a142058ffb491684d610c8b0c28946"></span>

<img src="https://gblobscdn.gitbook.com/assets%2F-Mij72ebV4OjqJvBacMy%2F-MjJyxjpbtswDc9Z_-0G%2F-MjJz0Yy-oHOqyzhQnJd%2Fimage.png?alt=media&amp;token=63d914af-e825-4975-a0ad-b5b208d858f1" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="23f4a9b4617145e2906259774b971c41"><span offset-key="23f4a9b4617145e2906259774b971c41:0">30 days of python practice ​ ​</span></span><span slate-void="true" key="0d4076fa48c14cd88efc7dc8a283744f"></span>

<img src="https://gblobscdn.gitbook.com/assets%2F-Mij72ebV4OjqJvBacMy%2F-MjJyxjpbtswDc9Z_-0G%2F-MjJz6wCS2vBE_SesVeR%2Fimage.png?alt=media&amp;token=da49b122-d6f9-432a-85ee-a570695369e7" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="0bfe1a6e68514325a7cac4df5411cc93"><span offset-key="0bfe1a6e68514325a7cac4df5411cc93:0"> ​</span></span>

<span key="85029254557b4f59ae683b6773733a29">**Understanding variables**</span>

<span key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c"><span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:0">​ Variables are simply declarations that are used to store certain values. For instance, the variable </span>`name`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:2"> can hold the value of </span>`John Smith.`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:4"> Several rules need to be considered when declaring variable names. For starters, a variable name cannot begin with a number. ​ </span>`2name = incorrect #incorrect`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:6"> ​ </span>`name = correct #correct`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:8"> ​ Variable names are case sensitive. This means that the variable </span>`school`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:10"> is not the same as </span>`School`<span offset-key="908258aa8b734d3f8291a70682aeee6c:12">. ​ Variables can hold different data types. This includes strings, integers, Booleans, long, lists, and arrays. ​ In Python, we do not need to declare the data type while writing a variable. This is because the code is compiled and interpreted later. The compiler will throw an error in case there is a mismatch in the data types. ​ Let’s talk about the different data types. ​ 1. Strings ​ Strings are usually presented in a text format. We will declare a string variable, as shown below. ​</span></span>

1

<span key="a55bde49b8e14cd4b00c8d31c5c993e2"><span offset-key="a55bde49b8e14cd4b00c8d31c5c993e2:0">name = “john”school = “Alliance Francaise”</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="c6dbb4f261c74ed8b5cede4839519946"><span offset-key="c6dbb4f261c74ed8b5cede4839519946:0">​ When we run </span>`print(name)`<span offset-key="c6dbb4f261c74ed8b5cede4839519946:2">, the output will be </span>`john`<span offset-key="c6dbb4f261c74ed8b5cede4839519946:4">. ​ 1. Integers ​ These variables hold numeric values, as shown below. ​</span></span>

1

<span key="783f5f8606e1431aa3b8359e7b0a2366"><span offset-key="783f5f8606e1431aa3b8359e7b0a2366:0">math = 90chemistry = 100biology = 70</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="b1a201ec00ce40f681c3dda31fdcf061"><span offset-key="b1a201ec00ce40f681c3dda31fdcf061:0">​ We can find the total of the variables above using the following statement. ​</span></span>

1

<span key="d1d76cd6a6604e57b1dd29f253d2e3a5"><span offset-key="d1d76cd6a6604e57b1dd29f253d2e3a5:0">print(math+chemistry+biology)</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="6c449c6a64e8474399182f8607e50ce5"><span offset-key="6c449c6a64e8474399182f8607e50ce5:0">​ The total is </span>`260`<span offset-key="6c449c6a64e8474399182f8607e50ce5:2">. ​ A TypeError is thrown when you try to add a string to an integer, as shwon below. ​</span></span>

1

<span key="4e1512d252e248c1b4a85ce06542cd8c"><span offset-key="4e1512d252e248c1b4a85ce06542cd8c:0">var1 = "30" #stringvar2 = 20 #integer​print(var1+var2)#type error</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024"><span offset-key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024:0">​ We can sum </span>`var1`<span offset-key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024:2"> and </span>`var2`<span offset-key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024:4"> by converting </span>`var1`<span offset-key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024:6"> to an integer using the </span>`int()`<span offset-key="7270e8fdd3d849f29dc4e04f8a4c2024:8"> function. The following code will execute successfully. ​</span></span>

1

<span key="2a205d4a8dba49bfac6431e790718179"><span offset-key="2a205d4a8dba49bfac6431e790718179:0">var1 = "30" #stringvar2 = 20 #integer​print(int(var1)+var2) # Output: 50</span></span>

> <span key="ba2447a526d6434faa13e8fb25bbe1ff">**Understanding functions or methods**</span>
>
> <span key="5aa5009080404f73ab2e520d48b7ae7d"><span offset-key="5aa5009080404f73ab2e520d48b7ae7d:0">​ Methods are quite critical in programming. They help store reusable code. This means that a person can call already declared methods rather than writing statements from scratch repeatedly. This saves significant time, that can be invested in other productive activities. ​ In Python, we use the </span>`def`<span offset-key="5aa5009080404f73ab2e520d48b7ae7d:2"> keyword to declare a function. An example of a python method is shown below. ​</span></span>
>
> 1

> Copied!

The function then returns the sum of the two values. It is important to take note of the data types when passing parameters. For instance, the </span>`calculateTotal`<span offset-key="2bd838f17d364d858543577937d6885d:4"> method will not work when we pass in a string as a parameter. This is because the program cannot sum up an integer and a string. > <span key="0b5a8b779fa64260a65c47f056eb2f61">**Understanding loops**</span>

The main loops are </span>`for`<span offset-key="14745eb1e356437ba05b3de65b3d38f8:2"> and </span>`while`<span offset-key="14745eb1e356437ba05b3de65b3d38f8:4">. ​ 1. > <span key="f7c45a7af0e6462ba146ff1fd51503ee">**Classes**</span>

> <span key="a29de9ab02df41d8b837051e48ef14dc"><span offset-key="a29de9ab02df41d8b837051e48ef14dc:0">​ The command line allows you to execute single lines of code at a time. It is often used when trying out a new function or method in the language. ​ Another cool thing that you can generally do with all languages, are comments. In python, a comment starts with a </span>`#`<span offset-key="a29de9ab02df41d8b837051e48ef14dc:2">. The computer ignores all text starting after the </span>`#`<span offset-key="a29de9ab02df41d8b837051e48ef14dc:4">. ​ </span>*shortcom.py*<span offset-key="a29de9ab02df41d8b837051e48ef14dc:6"> ​</span></span>

> <span key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751"><span offset-key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751:0">​ If you have a huge comment, do </span>**not**<span offset-key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751:2"> comment all the 350 lines, just put </span>`'''`<span offset-key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751:4"> before it, and </span>`'''`<span offset-key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751:6"> at the end. Technically, this is not a comment but a string, but the computer still ignores it, so we will use it. ​ </span>*longcom.py*<span offset-key="d5523b8878f349a28c96832730140751:8"> ​</span></span>

There is also a less used one, called a float. Mainly, these are integers with decimals. Change them using the </span>`float()`<span offset-key="0d9c0f77abee4ed8bf94e9e1eba5553e:11"> command. ​ </span>*vars2.py*<span offset-key="0d9c0f77abee4ed8bf94e9e1eba5553e:13"> ​</span></span>

>
>     <span key="07bf6d09cbc947e08cd2872135d9a7aa"><span offset-key="07bf6d09cbc947e08cd2872135d9a7aa:0">Python has created a lot of functions that are located in other .py files. You need to import these </span>**modules**<span offset-key="07bf6d09cbc947e08cd2872135d9a7aa:2"> to gain access to the,, You may wonder why python did this. The purpose of separate modules is to make python faster. Instead of storing millions and millions of functions, , it only needs a few basic ones. To import a module, you must write </span>`input                                                       <modulename>`<span offset-key="07bf6d09cbc947e08cd2872135d9a7aa:4">. Do not add the .py extension to the file name. In this example , we will be using a python created module named random.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f27cca6c9b4d4e19acf304a97d396c21"><span offset-key="f27cca6c9b4d4e19acf304a97d396c21:0">​</span></span>

>     <span key="8d2d8b598f8443f5a845319e692fa79f"><span offset-key="8d2d8b598f8443f5a845319e692fa79f:0">The while loop runs the code while something stays true. You would put </span>`while                                                       <expression>`<span offset-key="8d2d8b598f8443f5a845319e692fa79f:2">. Every time the loop runs, it evaluates if the expression is True. It it is, it runs the code, if not it continues outside of the loop. For example:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8ead02e9fea04af3a821303ec254a550"><span offset-key="8ead02e9fea04af3a821303ec254a550:0">​</span></span>

If so, it runs the code, if not, it continues on. It is kind of like a while loop, but it executes </span>**only once**<span offset-key="10f57b7eb49347fc9310279aab6e26b3:2">. An if statement is written:</span></span>

Hooray!!!')if num > 5: print('Num is greater than 5')if num == 12: print('Num is 12, which means that there is a problem with the python language, see if you can figure it out. Extra credit if you can figure it out!')</span></span>

>     <span key="5091c4580fd74751a5fb3fc93abdd1c3"><span offset-key="5091c4580fd74751a5fb3fc93abdd1c3:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="758e15a7807945ac85adca69ab55d473"><span offset-key="758e15a7807945ac85adca69ab55d473:0">Make sure that you have the check-box “Add Python 3.6 to PATH”, checked.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="06fb0df34efd44098c5754f77ab3c902"><span offset-key="06fb0df34efd44098c5754f77ab3c902:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6489585e0cbc45eb874651543b3f42c0"><span offset-key="6489585e0cbc45eb874651543b3f42c0:0">Once you have installed Python, you can launch the Python Shell.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4a504140e63b4dd088b0bf01e56f82db"><span offset-key="4a504140e63b4dd088b0bf01e56f82db:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="0293e17795f6495ba8687f03df1b0c25"><span offset-key="0293e17795f6495ba8687f03df1b0c25:0">Windows - Launch cmd prompt by typing in ‘cmd’ command.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="52a15eafed0a47e68d1eb9a56275896d"><span offset-key="52a15eafed0a47e68d1eb9a56275896d:0">Mac or Linux - Launch up terminal.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="49c539ec06f7466789b2edbe59c9b243"><span offset-key="49c539ec06f7466789b2edbe59c9b243:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5e0fa47a651e45cba36a5852a2077498"><span offset-key="5e0fa47a651e45cba36a5852a2077498:0">Command to launch Python 3 is different in Mac.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f5b19238ac6b4b49b1e0683bdc021df6"><span offset-key="f5b19238ac6b4b49b1e0683bdc021df6:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="79eaa56eca19405e9e60c74266fcbd1a"><span offset-key="79eaa56eca19405e9e60c74266fcbd1a:0">In Mac, type in </span>`python3`</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="22b25af64ad049999428bc0c2c66696e"><span offset-key="22b25af64ad049999428bc0c2c66696e:0">In other operating systems, including windows, type </span>`python`</span>
>
>     <span key="9dcb67f8a9d74ea29e4f4ed522510183"><span offset-key="9dcb67f8a9d74ea29e4f4ed522510183:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fc67ffb527a941979eaf25af15460756"><span offset-key="fc67ffb527a941979eaf25af15460756:0">You can type code in python shell and code as well!</span></span>
>
>     <span key="cd636beb7e334f8c97a3ece87887b43e"><span offset-key="cd636beb7e334f8c97a3ece87887b43e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c6841f5ed3974adca7d5019762c87861"><span offset-key="c6841f5ed3974adca7d5019762c87861:0">You can use </span>`print(5*4)`<span offset-key="c6841f5ed3974adca7d5019762c87861:2">, and it shows </span>`20`<span offset-key="c6841f5ed3974adca7d5019762c87861:4">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f3e02f5d1f4d48a184c5dbbcb25927f3"><span offset-key="f3e02f5d1f4d48a184c5dbbcb25927f3:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="47423ebb2f9e40f68ff80eb9fea06c49"><span offset-key="47423ebb2f9e40f68ff80eb9fea06c49:0">You can execute the code, and the shell would immediately give you output.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="28ebac7aabb74446a59ee89b265e0bb5"><span offset-key="28ebac7aabb74446a59ee89b265e0bb5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b8e60169bd7943cc840c07a607190915"><span offset-key="b8e60169bd7943cc840c07a607190915:0">Using the the Python Shell is an awesome way to learn Python.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5e02775725b5437591519853a1f0df64"><span offset-key="5e02775725b5437591519853a1f0df64:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ca9a3dbef796433b872c5167bc71e6cf">**Chapter 02 - Introduction To Python Programming**</span>
>
>     <span key="3da296844682427a88e051ce39e09c07"><span offset-key="3da296844682427a88e051ce39e09c07:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b29c5975c81d4641b4fb227a48b51b5c"><span offset-key="b29c5975c81d4641b4fb227a48b51b5c:0">Most programmers find programming a lot of fun, and besides, it also gets their work done.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="e8d7dd45a1b8474d8bf3dd8abc80d62e"><span offset-key="e8d7dd45a1b8474d8bf3dd8abc80d62e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="aefbb40b8b7548a9b35c5652c22c34ef"><span offset-key="aefbb40b8b7548a9b35c5652c22c34ef:0">Programming mainly involves </span>*problem solving*<span offset-key="aefbb40b8b7548a9b35c5652c22c34ef:2">, where one makes use of a computer to solve a real world problem.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a0bf9b7c91704a8fba8b72d84273e076"><span offset-key="a0bf9b7c91704a8fba8b72d84273e076:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8a470972b56745ab99407854505b5e44"><span offset-key="8a470972b56745ab99407854505b5e44:0">During our journey here, we will approach programming in a very different way. We will not only introduce you to the Python language, but also help you pick up essential problem solving skills.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ba1d67f25a884c13ae306de682772473"><span offset-key="ba1d67f25a884c13ae306de682772473:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="14c8b3ea371f427baed314012ac30a48"><span offset-key="14c8b3ea371f427baed314012ac30a48:0">As a programmer, you need to be able to look at a problem, and identify the important programming concepts relevant to solving it. Finally, you need to be able to use the language features and syntax, to express your solution on the computer. While all this looks complex, we want to make it easy for you. Together, we will tackle a variety of programming challenges, using these same steps. We will start with simple challenges (such as a Multiplication Table), and gradually increase the difficulty level over the duration of this book.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a1528b39bc7c4a31b7cd68615ef3da10"><span offset-key="a1528b39bc7c4a31b7cd68615ef3da10:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9ca94f62ada34355928ce968bcf1fb66"><span offset-key="9ca94f62ada34355928ce968bcf1fb66:0">Learning to program is a lot like learning to ride a bicycle. The first few steps are the most challenging ones.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b5899bc4e53a4872b992da7ebfa54074"><span offset-key="b5899bc4e53a4872b992da7ebfa54074:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="45b5b1ca0a9449c8ab290a126730e33b"><span offset-key="45b5b1ca0a9449c8ab290a126730e33b:0">Once you get over these initial steps, your experience will become more and more enjoyable.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="0a80996da39c456990c18dc108165c82"><span offset-key="0a80996da39c456990c18dc108165c82:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4eb5a067694b493ea5bfa035347c8ae5"><span offset-key="4eb5a067694b493ea5bfa035347c8ae5:0">Are you ready for your first programming challenge? Let’s get going now! We wish you all the best.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b7bdab475fb9435db6439c5f93e2fa9b"><span offset-key="b7bdab475fb9435db6439c5f93e2fa9b:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6b9d405d3cb841f48a5d8c6b2293c967">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="94faead773ed42f68364aac9527acc7e"><span offset-key="94faead773ed42f68364aac9527acc7e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="aba23b6e418d4fdcb3a96d0368e63752"><span offset-key="aba23b6e418d4fdcb3a96d0368e63752:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="e53f7af3899b4ea5a2c62a54bd2e80e4"><span offset-key="e53f7af3899b4ea5a2c62a54bd2e80e4:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="d05517ff401442f38be5ef9a253d6b03"><span offset-key="d05517ff401442f38be5ef9a253d6b03:0">Were introduced to the concept of problem solving</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="9324639843d945fda798f49324a2d764"><span offset-key="9324639843d945fda798f49324a2d764:0">Understood how good programmers approach problem solving</span></span>
>
>     <span key="57a83504b76644b39c0ec1043a82f149"><span offset-key="57a83504b76644b39c0ec1043a82f149:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6541878aa8de4dd08ae613974dbcf8d7">**Step 01: Our First Programming Challenge**</span>
>
>     <span key="86ffecd0847b4832be4563eeeb2c1ff6"><span offset-key="86ffecd0847b4832be4563eeeb2c1ff6:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9e696491be8845958275ecda5fcbf2d3"><span offset-key="9e696491be8845958275ecda5fcbf2d3:0">Our first </span>*programming challenge*<span offset-key="9e696491be8845958275ecda5fcbf2d3:2"> aims to do, what every kid does in math class: read out a multiplication table. We now want to give this task to the computer. Here is the statement of our problem:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="293e234f5a654599b9bbbb567fff39de"><span offset-key="293e234f5a654599b9bbbb567fff39de:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c416d0ef5c494171ba83fe2e11244aa5">**The Print Multiplication Table Challenge (PMT-Challenge)**</span>
>
>     <span key="8235a3217ae04deb8b355f2ca3464925"><span offset-key="8235a3217ae04deb8b355f2ca3464925:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="0e4cf38abd0143938b3cb356db2f0df1"><span offset-key="0e4cf38abd0143938b3cb356db2f0df1:0">Compute the multiplication table for </span>`5`<span offset-key="0e4cf38abd0143938b3cb356db2f0df1:2">, with entries from </span>`1`<span offset-key="0e4cf38abd0143938b3cb356db2f0df1:4"> to </span>`10`<span offset-key="0e4cf38abd0143938b3cb356db2f0df1:6">.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="0012688f7a55451a836136da9fe739ab"><span offset-key="0012688f7a55451a836136da9fe739ab:0">Display this table.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="029da65a36a745a6972dc0179b657896"><span offset-key="029da65a36a745a6972dc0179b657896:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="546ad1f1631b44488b2a60573f497df0"><span offset-key="546ad1f1631b44488b2a60573f497df0:0">The display needs to be:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="31625fd2af114367a3aa9eed5c3c74e0"><span offset-key="31625fd2af114367a3aa9eed5c3c74e0:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="02e81657e5dd4a878c3905504c3c507e">***5 \* 1 = 5***</span>
>
>     <span key="c0b9c842c8fa445e833d6105962f73b2"><span offset-key="c0b9c842c8fa445e833d6105962f73b2:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c4a571e0e5df4982a2882e208302ef48">***5 \* 2 = 10***</span>
>
>     <span key="02b907ad98fd42ccbd2c13854db5acfe"><span offset-key="02b907ad98fd42ccbd2c13854db5acfe:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6af80c1a3794455088db0fd7d29557fb">***5 \* 3 = 15***</span>
>
>     <span key="4db990063d4043a4b45ab254031d7926"><span offset-key="4db990063d4043a4b45ab254031d7926:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ecd16d7459ad44a385239d847b4e8dcb">***5 \* 4 = 20***</span>
>
>     <span key="76f40a9f7c6c456a86b7068a069d5034"><span offset-key="76f40a9f7c6c456a86b7068a069d5034:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ba5179decb584ff8b24dc10c14a0e5c2">***5 \* 5 = 25***</span>
>
>     <span key="284c088edef342659d308dd8029ef3d9"><span offset-key="284c088edef342659d308dd8029ef3d9:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="71553929acfd4ef6bea64e454b581b1b">***5 \* 6 = 30***</span>
>
>     <span key="e2029f08f4dd45dba811abfc6860c02c"><span offset-key="e2029f08f4dd45dba811abfc6860c02c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5bfd968923c14661ab374bdfc7b1aa44">***5 \* 7 = 35***</span>
>
>     <span key="a155d413bddd48ca9cd475d30033468e"><span offset-key="a155d413bddd48ca9cd475d30033468e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f7d4919ecb5043f785d2237b5326a015">***5 \* 8 = 40***</span>
>
>     <span key="9dbf170b638a4d4ab5bf70dd6178d51f"><span offset-key="9dbf170b638a4d4ab5bf70dd6178d51f:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="bbee8126d06e4637a9d64547cdd7c87c">***5 \* 9 = 45***</span>
>
>     <span key="2ef9e0a0212b41d59e831510020a0f2c"><span offset-key="2ef9e0a0212b41d59e831510020a0f2c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="e813dc898acc44368d0a32a975a7a15a">***5 \* 10 = 50***</span>
>
>     <span key="a818b5bb0ada4b58b20c9385ce2a9b5c"><span offset-key="a818b5bb0ada4b58b20c9385ce2a9b5c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="0d756aaaf1f24dd480e09250312a5dc0"><span offset-key="0d756aaaf1f24dd480e09250312a5dc0:0">This is the challenge. For convenience, let’s give it a label, say </span>*PMT-Challenge*<span offset-key="0d756aaaf1f24dd480e09250312a5dc0:2">. What would be the important concepts we need to learn, to solve this challenge? The following list of concepts would be a good starting point:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="68522b6257fd4f259d9d78be823196f1"><span offset-key="68522b6257fd4f259d9d78be823196f1:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="82821c6009e2422b8d71bd40eb7fe0a9">**Statements**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="084790759eee48d78a7fc951aa9bba0d">**Expressions**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="00329cfa269f43f8bd43e0ae0482b26e">**Variables**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="b6f53653f1a747c6a1131b2103b0b289">**Literals**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="a9a974e7e0ba4a68bb2c1325f3216288">**Conditionals**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="d31e7a42d6ae4a24adfed0548cebdc4d">**Loops**</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="6e4bd942fb1b4ca69f1c7bb74bde54ec">**Methods**</span>
>
>     <span key="d52ff4cd16b94883a2eed615cb08df6d"><span offset-key="d52ff4cd16b94883a2eed615cb08df6d:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="2f13561b8ebf48019fd4e63a48b51395"><span offset-key="2f13561b8ebf48019fd4e63a48b51395:0">In the rest of this chapter, we will introduce these concepts to you, one-by-one. We will also show you how learning each concept, takes us closer to a solution to </span>*PMT-Challenge*<span offset-key="2f13561b8ebf48019fd4e63a48b51395:2">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="722d38cbe4ff45fe92263481c31ae58d"><span offset-key="722d38cbe4ff45fe92263481c31ae58d:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ae3c2ab6094f4405b97237391d4ea629">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="2e38eaf17b99468bb8deeb823adb1e89"><span offset-key="2e38eaf17b99468bb8deeb823adb1e89:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="0f42152bbf1643e18cec2d273acd6ab4"><span offset-key="0f42152bbf1643e18cec2d273acd6ab4:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="59cd3cda43114e5e9b61e7c2bfa1e802"><span offset-key="59cd3cda43114e5e9b61e7c2bfa1e802:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="2a35ea85df89492bb15b06145b1af42b"><span offset-key="2a35ea85df89492bb15b06145b1af42b:0">Stated our first programming challenge</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="24cabc2a6b9e4bb284191ec088eadabf"><span offset-key="24cabc2a6b9e4bb284191ec088eadabf:0">Identified what programming concepts we need to learn, to solve this challenge</span></span>
>
>     <span key="36f9dd414fa6490680bfba5df2311d1d"><span offset-key="36f9dd414fa6490680bfba5df2311d1d:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="d7b1648b2c324f558f55f2191a5aca00">**Step 02: Breaking Down PMT-Challenge**</span>
>
>     <span key="0006ab81a00b473ea8998b35d2363c98"><span offset-key="0006ab81a00b473ea8998b35d2363c98:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="e35bf71964534304a5a02b5af6ba9544"><span offset-key="e35bf71964534304a5a02b5af6ba9544:0">Typically when we do programming, we have problems. Solving the problem typically need a step-by -step approach. Common sense tells us that to solve a complex problem, we break it into smaller parts, and solve each part one by one. Here is how any good programmer worth her salt, would solve a problem:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a4df87358271486b8b37369f7f70ce75"><span offset-key="a4df87358271486b8b37369f7f70ce75:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="d7f2cf92966f4778a34d19e867ced1ac"><span offset-key="d7f2cf92966f4778a34d19e867ced1ac:0">Simplify the problem, by breaking it into sub-problems</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="2c56e13ca1264d749b42952686aac2c7"><span offset-key="2c56e13ca1264d749b42952686aac2c7:0">Solve the sub-problems in stages (in some order), using the language</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="83ba3cb080c648ee93c629dc59eef51c"><span offset-key="83ba3cb080c648ee93c629dc59eef51c:0">Combine these solutions to get a final solution</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9f0c8b95fe1d43cca69106e45ceb47fc"><span offset-key="9f0c8b95fe1d43cca69106e45ceb47fc:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc"><span offset-key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc:0">The </span>*PMT-Challenge*<span offset-key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc:2"> is no different! Now how do we break it down, and where do we really start? Once again, your common sense will reveal a solution. As a first step, we could get the computer to calculate say, </span>`5 * 3`<span offset-key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc:4">. The second thing we can do, is to try and print the calculated value, in a manner similar to </span>`5 * 3 = 15`<span offset-key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc:6">. Then, we could repeat what we just did, to print out all the entries of the </span>`5`<span offset-key="5d58ad605ba94f618f3d677c88dce0fc:8"> multiplication table. Let’s put it down a little more formally:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="82a3dbe803fb4c7e84a932acd538eb9a"><span offset-key="82a3dbe803fb4c7e84a932acd538eb9a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4ec85eb0a956418b9f40b7639d37db35"><span offset-key="4ec85eb0a956418b9f40b7639d37db35:0">Here is how our draft steps look like</span></span>
>
>     <span key="aa1d624599e849bca089946357d4a9b1"><span offset-key="aa1d624599e849bca089946357d4a9b1:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="9fab4c2a0e4c44048a8c1f943464dc3f"><span offset-key="9fab4c2a0e4c44048a8c1f943464dc3f:0">Calculate </span>`5 * 3`<span offset-key="9fab4c2a0e4c44048a8c1f943464dc3f:2"> and print result as </span>`15`</span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="48e282411b8743818d34c390a74b3771"><span offset-key="48e282411b8743818d34c390a74b3771:0">Print </span>`5 * 3 = 15`<span offset-key="48e282411b8743818d34c390a74b3771:2"> (</span>`15`<span offset-key="48e282411b8743818d34c390a74b3771:4"> is result of previous calculation)</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="36a63949705e469c892cf94a962f588a"><span offset-key="36a63949705e469c892cf94a962f588a:0">Do this ten times, once for each table entry (going from </span>`1`<span offset-key="36a63949705e469c892cf94a962f588a:2"> to </span>`10`<span offset-key="36a63949705e469c892cf94a962f588a:4">)</span></span>
>
>     <span key="26b65ecd659349298a88ce98515c95f1"><span offset-key="26b65ecd659349298a88ce98515c95f1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f7aa9e52b8834cd3bd85d4cddaa932bb"><span offset-key="f7aa9e52b8834cd3bd85d4cddaa932bb:0">Let’s start with that kind of a game plan, and see where it takes us.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1af30894043c418a88a3afc88ee36e65"><span offset-key="1af30894043c418a88a3afc88ee36e65:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9836ea62b52c481f90cc2537ef9702de">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="8a7b992cfa74466788ff644e46e26df1"><span offset-key="8a7b992cfa74466788ff644e46e26df1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="99358377fe5d4af2a1fcddb26a8e2eb0"><span offset-key="99358377fe5d4af2a1fcddb26a8e2eb0:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="614297d91cfa4272b75c3b914b84b44e"><span offset-key="614297d91cfa4272b75c3b914b84b44e:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="41012721efd248e49b8ca9cc597c2e32"><span offset-key="41012721efd248e49b8ca9cc597c2e32:0">Learned that breaking down a problem into sub-problems is a great help</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="57e00d93d44f43d797057bfd07dcc4e8"><span offset-key="57e00d93d44f43d797057bfd07dcc4e8:0">Found a way to break down the </span>*PMT-Challenge*<span offset-key="57e00d93d44f43d797057bfd07dcc4e8:2"> problem</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ea699dbca57e4e29a164bdb6b87bf22a"><span offset-key="ea699dbca57e4e29a164bdb6b87bf22a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="134f826eb7914cd5abdd27484da8aa78">**Step 03: Introducing Operators And Expressions**</span>
>
>     <span key="5b818b81d1744900851401dd2174f17c"><span offset-key="5b818b81d1744900851401dd2174f17c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="120ea9e38f6b432e8203440585cca399"><span offset-key="120ea9e38f6b432e8203440585cca399:0">Let’s focus on solving the first sub-problem of </span>*PMT-Challenge*<span offset-key="120ea9e38f6b432e8203440585cca399:2">, the numeric computation. We want the computer to calculate </span>`5 * 5`<span offset-key="120ea9e38f6b432e8203440585cca399:4"> for example, and print </span>`25`<span offset-key="120ea9e38f6b432e8203440585cca399:6"> for us. How do we get it to do that? That’s what we would be looking at in this step.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4cbf1998730848b69671d6c44cd8164f"><span offset-key="4cbf1998730848b69671d6c44cd8164f:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="38c47431412746af977ed96f8a239932">**Snippet-01: Introducing Operators**</span>
>
>     <span key="55e9a6e4c1f54116a2242fc8f63ae168"><span offset-key="55e9a6e4c1f54116a2242fc8f63ae168:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="cf6b3ae7346849b193b554fecf7029af"><span offset-key="cf6b3ae7346849b193b554fecf7029af:0">Launch up Python shell. We want to calculate </span>`5 * 5`<span offset-key="cf6b3ae7346849b193b554fecf7029af:2">. How do we do that?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="17765ef84ce540a0b87edbe1ef58a250"><span offset-key="17765ef84ce540a0b87edbe1ef58a250:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="27ae1811ca874ba7bae469b9c83c396b"><span offset-key="27ae1811ca874ba7bae469b9c83c396b:0">Using our knowledge of school math, let’s try </span>`5 X 5`<span offset-key="27ae1811ca874ba7bae469b9c83c396b:2">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c1eb87d1fb534b02a472cb6fe549cc3c"><span offset-key="c1eb87d1fb534b02a472cb6fe549cc3c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="88b1ed39512a4b2987ab3cccf8a68490"><span offset-key="88b1ed39512a4b2987ab3cccf8a68490:0">&gt;&gt; 5 X 5 File "&lt; stdin >", line 1 5 X 5 ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="49f66935314943c39622bc2938940e0b"><span offset-key="49f66935314943c39622bc2938940e0b:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ee8d32206b7446668396dc5ebd9f5da5"><span offset-key="ee8d32206b7446668396dc5ebd9f5da5:0">The Python Shell hits back at us, saying “</span>*invalid syntax*<span offset-key="ee8d32206b7446668396dc5ebd9f5da5:2">”. This is how Python complains, when it doesn’t fully understand the code you type in. Here, it says our code has a “</span>**SyntaxError**<span offset-key="ee8d32206b7446668396dc5ebd9f5da5:4">”.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="96adb7c4e0394cf19500b466d1c4790a"><span offset-key="96adb7c4e0394cf19500b466d1c4790a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="106e2f61bd7a438d86d2cd40143541f0"><span offset-key="106e2f61bd7a438d86d2cd40143541f0:0">The reason why it complains, is because ‘</span>`X`<span offset-key="106e2f61bd7a438d86d2cd40143541f0:2">’ is not a valid </span>**operator**<span offset-key="106e2f61bd7a438d86d2cd40143541f0:4"> in Python.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9d15ff5d74bd4251bf5d80582bc06cde"><span offset-key="9d15ff5d74bd4251bf5d80582bc06cde:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="53819a156647460f8fc2287ed70afc41"><span offset-key="53819a156647460f8fc2287ed70afc41:0">The way you can do multiplication is by using the ‘</span>`*`<span offset-key="53819a156647460f8fc2287ed70afc41:2">’ </span>*operator*<span offset-key="53819a156647460f8fc2287ed70afc41:4"> .</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ae4c44c16adf4a9386e74aaf2691b71e"><span offset-key="ae4c44c16adf4a9386e74aaf2691b71e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603"><span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:0">“</span>*5 into 5*<span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:2">” is achieved by the code </span>`5 * 5`<span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:4">, and you can see the result </span>`25`<span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:6"> being printed. Similarly, </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:8"> gives us </span>`30`<span offset-key="ccb3dc6440f349a0b7ebeed76c55a603:10">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1ebcf759054c4695a284d5293c965a1b"><span offset-key="1ebcf759054c4695a284d5293c965a1b:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="4e676fc9b3084612a15fccff6d70a2b0"><span offset-key="4e676fc9b3084612a15fccff6d70a2b0:0">&gt;&gt; 5 \* 6 30</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="c22d194c635e4301ab72414aa3243ecf"><span offset-key="c22d194c635e4301ab72414aa3243ecf:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="dee3816681f6486fa6a57d308dc495f7"><span offset-key="dee3816681f6486fa6a57d308dc495f7:0">There are a wide range of other operators in Python:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c0f338ba833b4d0ca0b358042947434d"><span offset-key="c0f338ba833b4d0ca0b358042947434d:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="161076e371df4d289be5d77e0d4d85e8">`5 + 6`<span offset-key="161076e371df4d289be5d77e0d4d85e8:1"> gives a result of </span>`11`<span offset-key="161076e371df4d289be5d77e0d4d85e8:3">.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="02a7df4964c4495894793f0f8c6368de">`5 - 6`<span offset-key="02a7df4964c4495894793f0f8c6368de:1"> leads to </span>`-1`<span offset-key="02a7df4964c4495894793f0f8c6368de:3">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="75447631b45149f88c2c1372fc38060c"><span offset-key="75447631b45149f88c2c1372fc38060c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="716b182f9e71447aacef7a30acf980b3"><span offset-key="716b182f9e71447aacef7a30acf980b3:0">&gt;&gt; 5 + 611>&gt;&gt; 5 - 6-1</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="454848a34549410a96b260f53fefaacc"><span offset-key="454848a34549410a96b260f53fefaacc:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d">`10 / 2`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:1">, gives an output of </span>`5.0`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:3"> . There is one interesting operator, </span>`**`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:5">. Let’s try </span>`10 ** 3`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:7">. We ran this code, and the result we get is </span>`1000`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:9">. Yes you guessed right, the operator performs “to the power of”. “</span>`10`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:11"> to the power of </span>`3`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:13">” is </span>`10 * 10 * 10`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:15">, or </span>`1000`<span offset-key="c20e7913013149448fcf522cabb2480d:17">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fa98cbf66a9d45b2b324e2f859e88ff5"><span offset-key="fa98cbf66a9d45b2b324e2f859e88ff5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="c8e6dd158ab5486b916e75ea24a20a7a"><span offset-key="c8e6dd158ab5486b916e75ea24a20a7a:0">&gt;&gt; 10 / 2 5.0 >&gt;&gt; 10 \*\* 3 1000</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="65173cfd85e2475eb6451bb537b82842"><span offset-key="65173cfd85e2475eb6451bb537b82842:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad"><span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:0">Another interesting operator is </span>`%`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:2">, called “</span>*modulo*<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:4">”, which computes the remainder on integer division. If we do </span>`10 % 3`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:6">, what is the remainder when </span>`10`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:8"> is divided by </span>`3`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:10">? </span>`3 * 3`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:12"> is </span>`9`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:14">, and </span>`10 - 9`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:16"> is </span>`1`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:18">, which is what </span>`%`<span offset-key="1caa8ee304b647daad82b21d82f4b3ad:20"> returns in this case.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fd03c660382c4c708238cc1135966f2a"><span offset-key="fd03c660382c4c708238cc1135966f2a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6749f4f6cce14b8fa79f678dba3011ca"><span offset-key="6749f4f6cce14b8fa79f678dba3011ca:0">Let’s look at some terminology:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a7d2cfb53af74dd3bed33a204cfe6fd5"><span offset-key="a7d2cfb53af74dd3bed33a204cfe6fd5:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126"><span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:0">Whatever pieces of code we gave Python shell to run, are called </span>**expressions**<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:2">. So, </span>`5 * 5`<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:4">, </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:6"> and </span>`5 - 6`<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:8"> are all </span>*expressions*<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:10">. An expression is composed of </span>*operators*<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:12"> and </span>**operands**<span offset-key="3a226abe3de145d480dab8435bb00126:14">.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54"><span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:0">In the expression </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:2">, the two values </span>`5`<span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:4"> and </span>`6`<span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:6"> are called operands, and the </span>`*`<span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:8"> operator </span>*operates*<span offset-key="a3521ba11cde47a6abb149eb177aba54:10"> on them.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="8ef8a9dc9f354683a4fadcaef93eeef9"><span offset-key="8ef8a9dc9f354683a4fadcaef93eeef9:0">The values </span>`5`<span offset-key="8ef8a9dc9f354683a4fadcaef93eeef9:2"> and </span>`6`<span offset-key="8ef8a9dc9f354683a4fadcaef93eeef9:4"> are </span>**literals**<span offset-key="8ef8a9dc9f354683a4fadcaef93eeef9:6">, because those are constants which cannot be changed.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b972a9f7ab9c4d6d986a8617c122da1e"><span offset-key="b972a9f7ab9c4d6d986a8617c122da1e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488"><span offset-key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488:0">The cool thing about Python, is that you can even have expressions with multiple operators. Therefore, you can form an expression with </span>`5 + 5 + 5`<span offset-key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488:2">, which evaluates to </span>`15`<span offset-key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488:4">. This is an expression which has three operands, and two </span>`+`<span offset-key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488:6"> operators. You can even have expressions with different types of operators, such as in </span>`5 + 5 * 5`<span offset-key="ce4dfdfa12e749b5b4831d0e8b513488:8">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="14a5afffee46479fa7396be3ec107069"><span offset-key="14a5afffee46479fa7396be3ec107069:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="560215f3c1db4fd294f980afcccab67b"><span offset-key="560215f3c1db4fd294f980afcccab67b:0">&gt;&gt; 5 + 5 + 5 15 >&gt;&gt; 5 + 5 \* 5 30</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="26f8551e8cb547ba9b952fdfab4a000b"><span offset-key="26f8551e8cb547ba9b952fdfab4a000b:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="bcbf1ff6c00f4d4a9f9c83f9f728a7dd"><span offset-key="bcbf1ff6c00f4d4a9f9c83f9f728a7dd:0">Try and play around with the expressions, and understand the output which results.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="721f697bb2bb4b0184bc463c9dc3567c"><span offset-key="721f697bb2bb4b0184bc463c9dc3567c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="3183e5126ddd4e8888156f22f879dec7">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="49e1a5239f2b48b5aec3d13de465a55f"><span offset-key="49e1a5239f2b48b5aec3d13de465a55f:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="0d71c180e544445a8b8665a7d34545f2"><span offset-key="0d71c180e544445a8b8665a7d34545f2:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4b3d5f4d53634436bd3b93659582c9ad"><span offset-key="4b3d5f4d53634436bd3b93659582c9ad:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="3992a40fc3074d0a9fa906490978515f"><span offset-key="3992a40fc3074d0a9fa906490978515f:0">Learned how to give code input to the Python Shell</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="5ffbd9e1a02c4c1485053a6f2a91b373"><span offset-key="5ffbd9e1a02c4c1485053a6f2a91b373:0">Understood that Python has a predefined set of operators</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="1a9dff85fc904ac5814792d50fbc96e8"><span offset-key="1a9dff85fc904ac5814792d50fbc96e8:0">Used a few types of basic operators and their operands, to form expressions</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8b9270798d0b438d993d9f019c3d92c5"><span offset-key="8b9270798d0b438d993d9f019c3d92c5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="0dbba7030b6745139b44978a217116a9">**Step 04: Programming Exercise IN-PE-01**</span>
>
>     <span key="05a6a51a76ef49cea8c06561c9ac03c2"><span offset-key="05a6a51a76ef49cea8c06561c9ac03c2:0">​</span></span>
>

>     <span key="03945f02cce74147a2949ecee46d37d8"><span offset-key="03945f02cce74147a2949ecee46d37d8:0">How many number of hours are there in a day? </span>`24`<span offset-key="03945f02cce74147a2949ecee46d37d8:2">.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="b461bcae24e64c9fa27383087c1885b3"><span offset-key="b461bcae24e64c9fa27383087c1885b3:0">And how many minutes does each hour have? It’s </span>`60`<span offset-key="b461bcae24e64c9fa27383087c1885b3:2">.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="1ee725f1acd64df196a9ed61ab495858"><span offset-key="1ee725f1acd64df196a9ed61ab495858:0">So if you want to find out the number of minutes in a day, it’s </span>`24 * 60`<span offset-key="1ee725f1acd64df196a9ed61ab495858:2">, which is </span>`1440`<span offset-key="1ee725f1acd64df196a9ed61ab495858:4">.</span></span>

>
>     <span key="04ba485799a84a2e91afeb8e93d2bd9f"><span offset-key="04ba485799a84a2e91afeb8e93d2bd9f:0">Let’s start with the number of hours, </span>`24`<span offset-key="04ba485799a84a2e91afeb8e93d2bd9f:2">.</span></span>

> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="f7efbf5aafe74bebae27799d4f964343"><span offset-key="f7efbf5aafe74bebae27799d4f964343:0">The number of minutes in an hour is </span>`60`<span offset-key="f7efbf5aafe74bebae27799d4f964343:2">, and</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="e8faf2f992b444d2854b0bea1aaec10b"><span offset-key="e8faf2f992b444d2854b0bea1aaec10b:0">The number of seconds in a minute is </span>`60`<span offset-key="e8faf2f992b444d2854b0bea1aaec10b:2"> as well.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="7ad53fe3008a4556aded2a6583898410"><span offset-key="7ad53fe3008a4556aded2a6583898410:0">So it’s </span>`24 * 60 * 60`<span offset-key="7ad53fe3008a4556aded2a6583898410:2">, or </span>`86400`<span offset-key="7ad53fe3008a4556aded2a6583898410:4">.</span></span>

>
>     <span key="d571131dd7bf4411bc48e8a63b073db6"><span offset-key="d571131dd7bf4411bc48e8a63b073db6:0">In this step, we:</span></span>

>         <span key="c97c7fefae674d82a1a2da7fd1795fb2"><span offset-key="c97c7fefae674d82a1a2da7fd1795fb2:0">Expressions</span></span>

>         <span key="3fa5a1bc3bdb473e911d563b781c2659"><span offset-key="3fa5a1bc3bdb473e911d563b781c2659:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="7b0fec411a3c4e80ac019ff4855ed696">**Step 05: Puzzles On Expressions**</span>
>
>         <span key="7b5155982c6547a783587c34c417c0dc"><span offset-key="7b5155982c6547a783587c34c417c0dc:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="866583f67cb24fc3b0c6ae95b57ca8ac"><span offset-key="866583f67cb24fc3b0c6ae95b57ca8ac:0">Let’s look at a few puzzles related to expressions, in this step. Before that, let’s revise some of the terminology we had learned earlier.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="4b2218c704f74e66b8bd51821ffc6bbc"><span offset-key="4b2218c704f74e66b8bd51821ffc6bbc:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d">`5 + 6 + 10`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:1"> is an example of an expression. In this expression, </span>`5`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:3">, </span>`6`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:5"> and </span>`10`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:7"> are operands. The </span>`+`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:9"> here is the operator. You can have multiple operators in an expression. We also did mention that the operands, namely </span>`10`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:11">, </span>`6`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:13"> and </span>`5`<span offset-key="4c5a75bfb5294806b8d7a3d9e3410f8d:15">, are literals. Their values will not change.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="6925383c816547b4a6feb12b6fdb0355"><span offset-key="6925383c816547b4a6feb12b6fdb0355:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="71dae949e065445086e4cfda76d81c78"><span offset-key="71dae949e065445086e4cfda76d81c78:0">Here are a few puzzles coming up, to explore aspects of expressions.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="bc17e2c49cb843769dd7f9308c13b30e"><span offset-key="bc17e2c49cb843769dd7f9308c13b30e:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="dc6abc61e92f44608964965a45d63ced">**Snippet-01: Puzzles On Expressions**</span>
>
>         <span key="eefe41c5c47c4c40ac2aba2a8dc2e557"><span offset-key="eefe41c5c47c4c40ac2aba2a8dc2e557:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a"><span offset-key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a:0">Think about what would happen when you do something of this kind: </span>`5 $ 2`<span offset-key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a:2">. You’re right, it would throw a </span>`SyntaxError`<span offset-key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a:4">. When Python does not understand the code you type in, it reports an error. Here, the expression we’re typing is </span>`5 $ 2`<span offset-key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a:6">, which does not make sense to Python, hence the </span>`SyntaxError`<span offset-key="c7833a7533d1470698b3d0c94c4b217a:8">.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="9ff713ba67c6444d899b0df900c02c1d"><span offset-key="9ff713ba67c6444d899b0df900c02c1d:0">​</span></span>
>
>         1
>
>         <span key="366e3dd99d474babb7909dde017744b6"><span offset-key="366e3dd99d474babb7909dde017744b6:0">&gt;&gt; 5 $ 2 File "&lt; stdin >", line 1 5 $ 2 ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax >&gt;&gt; 5$2 File "&lt; stdin >", line 1 5 $ 2 ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax</span></span>
>
>         <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         Copied!
>
>         <span key="be2ef4304ad94545839ddf95612be044"><span offset-key="be2ef4304ad94545839ddf95612be044:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="a8584e0c7fff44f08edd3dec4f369e43"><span offset-key="a8584e0c7fff44f08edd3dec4f369e43:0">Let’s say we type in </span>`5+6+10`<span offset-key="a8584e0c7fff44f08edd3dec4f369e43:2">, without any spaces between the operands, and the operators. What do you think will happen? Surprisingly, the Python Shell does calculate the value!</span></span>
>
>         <span key="26b1c833ff78469391beb3818505de6b"><span offset-key="26b1c833ff78469391beb3818505de6b:0">​</span></span>
>
>         1
>
>         <span key="198241f56572480b89410b8040b277a3"><span offset-key="198241f56572480b89410b8040b277a3:0">&gt;&gt; 5+6+10 21</span></span>
>
>         <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         Copied!
>
>         <span key="bab948d97a264bf1931a450c099d7b3c"><span offset-key="bab948d97a264bf1931a450c099d7b3c:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="7608dcbb7af040f1b5194f6c06c2cc04"><span offset-key="7608dcbb7af040f1b5194f6c06c2cc04:0">In an expression, using spaces makes it easier for you to read it, but it’s not mandatory. </span>`5 + 6 + 10`<span offset-key="7608dcbb7af040f1b5194f6c06c2cc04:2"> is easier to read than </span>`5+6+10`<span offset-key="7608dcbb7af040f1b5194f6c06c2cc04:4">, but does not make any difference to the Python compiler.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="7ee760e625d44722aaef69bb50382551"><span offset-key="7ee760e625d44722aaef69bb50382551:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911"><span offset-key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911:0">The next puzzle tries to evaluate </span>`5 / 2`<span offset-key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911:2">, which is “</span>`5`<span offset-key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911:4"> divided by </span>`2`<span offset-key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911:6">”. What would be the output? </span>`2.5`<span offset-key="f2ef50c150ed465a88f510c4f3ebe911:8">.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="2842cafff86845b9bb256b2c2dfb8b33"><span offset-key="2842cafff86845b9bb256b2c2dfb8b33:0">​</span></span>
>
>         1
>
>         <span key="5cfe4f0a63a344e89c1b75a4f17790a9"><span offset-key="5cfe4f0a63a344e89c1b75a4f17790a9:0">&gt;&gt; 5/2 2.5</span></span>
>
>         <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         Copied!
>
>         <span key="3096307f1e8b40d7b6a95ba5b0b3fe13"><span offset-key="3096307f1e8b40d7b6a95ba5b0b3fe13:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="5549b09dc9b944519e0dfa745cae6b3d"><span offset-key="5549b09dc9b944519e0dfa745cae6b3d:0">If you’re coming from other programming languages like Java or C, this might be a surprising result. If you try this in Java for instance, you would get </span>`2`<span offset-key="5549b09dc9b944519e0dfa745cae6b3d:2"> as the output. Note that even though both operands are integers, the result of the </span>`/`<span offset-key="5549b09dc9b944519e0dfa745cae6b3d:4"> operation is a floating point value, </span>`2.5`<span offset-key="5549b09dc9b944519e0dfa745cae6b3d:6"> . Python does what is expected by a programmer!</span></span>
>
>         <span key="6f9fcdc4bb144bd7bee272c21e533a55"><span offset-key="6f9fcdc4bb144bd7bee272c21e533a55:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024"><span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:0">The puzzle after that tries to play with </span>`5 + 5 * 6`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:2">. What would be the result of this expression? Will it be </span>`5 + 5`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:4"> or </span>`10`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:6">, then </span>`10 * 6`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:8">, which is </span>`60`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:10">? Or, will it be </span>`5`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:12"> plus </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:14">, which is </span>`5`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:16"> + </span>`30`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:18">, that’s </span>`35`<span offset-key="95fe00c1079246d09218afff70d42024:20">?</span></span>
>
>         <span key="f10e004886c54465973d83faefb6f0a3"><span offset-key="f10e004886c54465973d83faefb6f0a3:0">​</span></span>
>
>         1
>
>         <span key="f930bbeff78a4f68b6e27a58d892ccbd"><span offset-key="f930bbeff78a4f68b6e27a58d892ccbd:0">&gt;&gt; 5 + 5 \* 6 35</span></span>
>
>         <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         Copied!
>
>         <span key="a9494dbc7ede4a6fa86060854713b602"><span offset-key="a9494dbc7ede4a6fa86060854713b602:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="9a52818d9ec44ff488c08228ad79f6bf"><span offset-key="9a52818d9ec44ff488c08228ad79f6bf:0">The correct result is </span>`35`<span offset-key="9a52818d9ec44ff488c08228ad79f6bf:2">.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="184758da84e846db8f119fc255568a69"><span offset-key="184758da84e846db8f119fc255568a69:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="c2960192d5ad446799be457f34611096"><span offset-key="c2960192d5ad446799be457f34611096:0">Python decides this is based on the </span>**precedence**<span offset-key="c2960192d5ad446799be457f34611096:2"> of operators.</span></span>
>
>         <span key="fa216493eb364a64984c04b8332b9fa8"><span offset-key="fa216493eb364a64984c04b8332b9fa8:0">​</span></span>
>
>         <span key="575a64808bb34b8ba8de94d1e30f9f14"><span offset-key="575a64808bb34b8ba8de94d1e30f9f14:0">Operators in Python are divided into two sets as follows:</span></span>
>
>         <span key="9e4677427dba4b7c9548a877ae017f64"><span offset-key="9e4677427dba4b7c9548a877ae017f64:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="8a66e9f0f3d941b9857a82a10f79e298">`**`<span offset-key="8a66e9f0f3d941b9857a82a10f79e298:1">, </span>`*`<span offset-key="8a66e9f0f3d941b9857a82a10f79e298:3">, </span>`/`<span offset-key="8a66e9f0f3d941b9857a82a10f79e298:5"> and </span>`%`<span offset-key="8a66e9f0f3d941b9857a82a10f79e298:7"> have higher precedence, or priority.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="260100d5ef114e6784964dc2ff6c459a">`+`<span offset-key="260100d5ef114e6784964dc2ff6c459a:1"> and </span>`-`<span offset-key="260100d5ef114e6784964dc2ff6c459a:3"> have a lower precedence.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="49eec69d1b51478593926ab0f0c7ba49"><span offset-key="49eec69d1b51478593926ab0f0c7ba49:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53"><span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:0">Sub-expressions involving operators from {</span>`*`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:2">, </span>`/`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:4">, </span>`%`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:6">, </span>`**`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:8">} are evaluated before those involving operators from {</span>`+`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:10">, </span>`-`<span offset-key="818ab6cb8ca14360a94d09b6f7beab53:12">}</span></span>
>
>     <span key="46e7843442ab44a2b223ab1714a08259"><span offset-key="46e7843442ab44a2b223ab1714a08259:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6"><span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:0">Let’s try another small puzzle on precedence, with </span>`5 - 2 * 2`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:2">. What would be the result of this? Will it be </span>`6`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:4">, or </span>`1`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:6">? It’s </span>`1`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:8">, because </span>`*`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:10"> has a higher precedence than </span>`-`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:12">. Thus </span>`2 * 2`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:14"> is </span>`4`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:16">, and </span>`5 - 4`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:18"> gives us </span>`1`<span offset-key="34b34a806ed84f56a37c62e3865dada6:20">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1a912ca02d334ae1b4b0ea6d011b69f2"><span offset-key="1a912ca02d334ae1b4b0ea6d011b69f2:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="85a7223c537d416783be0491f7cbdd0f"><span offset-key="85a7223c537d416783be0491f7cbdd0f:0">&gt;&gt; 5 - 2 \* 2 1</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="7f4821d5e18b45e5a49ca22536fdbb77"><span offset-key="7f4821d5e18b45e5a49ca22536fdbb77:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fb4638b6dca24edf91a1ad3ed762fee5"><span offset-key="fb4638b6dca24edf91a1ad3ed762fee5:0">Let’s say we want to execute </span>`5 - 2`<span offset-key="fb4638b6dca24edf91a1ad3ed762fee5:2">, to give an output of </span>`2`<span offset-key="fb4638b6dca24edf91a1ad3ed762fee5:4">. How do we change the operator precedence?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fb173712001c4e1d813eeea4335b77c0"><span offset-key="fb173712001c4e1d813eeea4335b77c0:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b2225b4524b548caa2ebdcfa7016e579"><span offset-key="b2225b4524b548caa2ebdcfa7016e579:0">You cannot really change the precedence, but you can add parentheses to group sub-expressions differently.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1eba61e9502b4542addf98c808a9e0bc"><span offset-key="1eba61e9502b4542addf98c808a9e0bc:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="a6946b6f2a49484f8613aa1d682b4436"><span offset-key="a6946b6f2a49484f8613aa1d682b4436:0">&gt;&gt; (5 - 2) \* 2 6 >&gt;&gt; 5 - ( 2 \* 2 ) 1</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="438d3feff9054a49985b1f51999c5572"><span offset-key="438d3feff9054a49985b1f51999c5572:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="7716f9039c5e4ae7accc8763044a0efc"><span offset-key="7716f9039c5e4ae7accc8763044a0efc:0">Parentheses have the highest precedence in Python, and can be used to override operator precedence. </span>`(5 - 2)`<span offset-key="7716f9039c5e4ae7accc8763044a0efc:2"> gets calculated first, and the final result of the expression is </span>`6`<span offset-key="7716f9039c5e4ae7accc8763044a0efc:4">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b7d2103fe924417fbc4952a4e42659ba"><span offset-key="b7d2103fe924417fbc4952a4e42659ba:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8fa0128156d549a2a7dd6374cb817c85"><span offset-key="8fa0128156d549a2a7dd6374cb817c85:0">A positive thing about using parentheses is, that it makes expressions more readable. So even in situations such as </span>`5 - 2 * 2`<span offset-key="8fa0128156d549a2a7dd6374cb817c85:2">, where we know the result according to precedence, adding parentheses is good.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="007b235a8e6c4ac5bdcb389f2353e299"><span offset-key="007b235a8e6c4ac5bdcb389f2353e299:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="528e9b42590b40aebddf97c36556f871">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="8889a810c8fc43988313721aeae8d6e1"><span offset-key="8889a810c8fc43988313721aeae8d6e1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="63f14a6aef8f4f9db56c7fd08d32720c"><span offset-key="63f14a6aef8f4f9db56c7fd08d32720c:0">In this step, we went about solving a few puzzles about expressions, touching concepts such as:</span></span>
>

>
>     <span key="69df26dcaa9946988b4e7f76a6df13b3">`SyntaxError`<span offset-key="69df26dcaa9946988b4e7f76a6df13b3:1"> for incorrect operators</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>

>

>     <span key="8d5041433a82452d819fac3f11b8ef64"><span offset-key="8d5041433a82452d819fac3f11b8ef64:0">Floating Point division by default</span></span>

>
>     <span key="78b88e6872174c1eafb85c82589b9909"><span offset-key="78b88e6872174c1eafb85c82589b9909:0">Operator Precedence</span></span>

>     <span key="32d8660e1dfd49389972f8749c83bab2"><span offset-key="32d8660e1dfd49389972f8749c83bab2:0">Using parentheses</span></span>
>
>     <span key="82739441630f42bbab2f10fca6d19980"><span offset-key="82739441630f42bbab2f10fca6d19980:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="afe5413d9fef4038b22739be580f00c7">**Step 06: Printing Text**</span>
>
>     <span key="1a62cf28b9b845adb279080471e3b08e"><span offset-key="1a62cf28b9b845adb279080471e3b08e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="d4ef07bfa46e4a508af2d663d6aaba89"><span offset-key="d4ef07bfa46e4a508af2d663d6aaba89:0">In the previous step, we learned how to use expressions to compute values. In this step, let’s see how we can actually print multiplication table entries, that are readable by the user.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="010a4be962134572b1582d6285cd4ebc"><span offset-key="010a4be962134572b1582d6285cd4ebc:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1d9868ed84c44a3e8f797040bddf0771">**Snippet-01: Printing Text**</span>
>
>     <span key="25dfc4196d8b437b87a95e30f55701f0"><span offset-key="25dfc4196d8b437b87a95e30f55701f0:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f8e2c2ca46c6486f8c9e11603123345a"><span offset-key="f8e2c2ca46c6486f8c9e11603123345a:0">How do we go about printing a complete multiplication table entry? We want to print text such as </span>`5 * 6 = 30`<span offset-key="f8e2c2ca46c6486f8c9e11603123345a:2"> . But trying to do so, as we know it, gives us a </span>`SyntaxError`<span offset-key="f8e2c2ca46c6486f8c9e11603123345a:4">. Clearly, there is a different way to print text, as compared to an expression.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="063b894e73774c3aaaba1c476876821e"><span offset-key="063b894e73774c3aaaba1c476876821e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="e928258f6a3642a99bc15335d2bebc5e"><span offset-key="e928258f6a3642a99bc15335d2bebc5e:0">&gt;&gt; 5 \* 6 = 30 File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 SyntaxError: can't assign to operator</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

>
>     <span key="bd3817777075483fafc69c29fd40d28a"><span offset-key="bd3817777075483fafc69c29fd40d28a:0">Let’s first try to print a simple piece of text, </span>`Hello`<span offset-key="bd3817777075483fafc69c29fd40d28a:2">. Typing in this piece of code directly on Python Shell also gives us an error.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fcd7979e9b5c4365af31ba6d12c340fc"><span offset-key="fcd7979e9b5c4365af31ba6d12c340fc:0">​</span></span>

>     1
>
>     <span key="70aaefb2131346cbbe92e74ccba2de82"><span offset-key="70aaefb2131346cbbe92e74ccba2de82:0">&gt;&gt; Hello Traceback (most recent call last): File "&lt;stdin>", line 1, in &lt;module> NameError: name 'Hello' is not defined</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="f422ca6a21f14d93959d687de5051290"><span offset-key="f422ca6a21f14d93959d687de5051290:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="702ddbb7623f46838f26a582259675ee"><span offset-key="702ddbb7623f46838f26a582259675ee:0">Only expressions work that way, and </span>`Hello`<span offset-key="702ddbb7623f46838f26a582259675ee:2"> is not really an expression.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="86f8c63cd2b54b7c95ed0062efd3425c"><span offset-key="86f8c63cd2b54b7c95ed0062efd3425c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e">`"Hello"`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:1"> is typically called a </span>**string**<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:3">, and represents the text of letters </span>`'H'`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:5">, </span>`'e'`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:7">, </span>`'l'`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:9">, </span>`'l'`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:11">, </span>`'o'`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:13">. </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:15"> is hence different from the number </span>`5`<span offset-key="b591829efe1c46afbc7e970b5273816e:17">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8ad4681887054df7addf16ce1216aea5"><span offset-key="8ad4681887054df7addf16ce1216aea5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="7830675fe32049d3b9920a0c33210134"><span offset-key="7830675fe32049d3b9920a0c33210134:0">There are a number of in-built functions in Python to help print strings. One of these is the </span>`print()`<span offset-key="7830675fe32049d3b9920a0c33210134:2"> function. Can you just say </span>`print Hello`<span offset-key="7830675fe32049d3b9920a0c33210134:4">?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6ecbab7bfbb24c7b91fc2c84ce589cd1"><span offset-key="6ecbab7bfbb24c7b91fc2c84ce589cd1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="f78a23c263d644259ee4e2401408bf97"><span offset-key="f78a23c263d644259ee4e2401408bf97:0">&gt;&gt; print Hello File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 print Hello ^ SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'. Did you mean print(Hello)?</span></span>

>
>     <span key="e1ecaae3a1a541cea95151fb00f7372e"><span offset-key="e1ecaae3a1a541cea95151fb00f7372e:0">Nope! Again, this one failed because you need to indicate that </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="e1ecaae3a1a541cea95151fb00f7372e:2"> is a string.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fbcbb07130834e2b83cc59d1b52bd78b"><span offset-key="fbcbb07130834e2b83cc59d1b52bd78b:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="408c5c6db8864a1a8041a48eae4c1c80"><span offset-key="408c5c6db8864a1a8041a48eae4c1c80:0">How do I indicate that </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="408c5c6db8864a1a8041a48eae4c1c80:2"> is a string? By putting it within double quotes.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="bed6c717ae8842d692729ecdfdfa0d88"><span offset-key="bed6c717ae8842d692729ecdfdfa0d88:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f4a3c14788ca4362a112153deb227794"><span offset-key="f4a3c14788ca4362a112153deb227794:0">Let’s try </span>`print                                                       ("Hello")`</span>
>

>
>     1
>
>     <span key="86a75b6bf1bb4d67b0552071d4d7577a"><span offset-key="86a75b6bf1bb4d67b0552071d4d7577a:0">&gt;&gt; print ("Hello") Hello >&gt;&gt; print("Hello") Hello</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
