>     <span key="dddccf6d1f534a7ea2f945ac0e05d956"><span offset-key="dddccf6d1f534a7ea2f945ac0e05d956:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="73bcd653cd774cd19b6844f6f4b58257">`print("Hello")`<span offset-key="73bcd653cd774cd19b6844f6f4b58257:1"> finally results in </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="73bcd653cd774cd19b6844f6f4b58257:3"> being printed out. To be able to print </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="73bcd653cd774cd19b6844f6f4b58257:5">, the things we need to do are:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ad39a38ef4734cdcb6ac2df57f112cfb"><span offset-key="ad39a38ef4734cdcb6ac2df57f112cfb:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="14f5e556c2364a4f9178f3854c2e6233"><span offset-key="14f5e556c2364a4f9178f3854c2e6233:0">Typing the method name print ,</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="e276e2ad66a845f7b286e4cfb95eb28a"><span offset-key="e276e2ad66a845f7b286e4cfb95eb28a:0">open parentheses ( ,</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="372d7c79bda14de290ea21e1845a7aa0"><span offset-key="372d7c79bda14de290ea21e1845a7aa0:0">Followed by a double quote " ,</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="62023d3c4dda4d36bd4305fa09faf5a9"><span offset-key="62023d3c4dda4d36bd4305fa09faf5a9:0">The text Hello,</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="a93b538f9d1d4bd3b3d04ad9e23a0281"><span offset-key="a93b538f9d1d4bd3b3d04ad9e23a0281:0">and another double quote " ,</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="c2219a97ee424c75880f1b4c75068cc3"><span offset-key="c2219a97ee424c75880f1b4c75068cc3:0">finished off with a closed parentheses ).</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9b6273266dbc413fb4fc810a20cbca39"><span offset-key="9b6273266dbc413fb4fc810a20cbca39:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454"><span offset-key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454:0">What we have written here is called a </span>**statement**<span offset-key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454:2">, a simple piece of code to execute. As part of this statement, we are </span>**calling**<span offset-key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454:4"> a </span>**function**<span offset-key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454:6">, named </span>`print()`<span offset-key="34adc82b156a4bf3992ad0d892bec454:8">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="494ac43b7b874296aec9fd70e26a1cf1"><span offset-key="494ac43b7b874296aec9fd70e26a1cf1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ca0d6d147ba947a1bda940e2eb9f666c"><span offset-key="ca0d6d147ba947a1bda940e2eb9f666c:0">What exactly are we trying to print?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c3364954b02645bb8037be848ec95ef3"><span offset-key="c3364954b02645bb8037be848ec95ef3:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15"><span offset-key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15:0">The text </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15:2">, which is called a </span>**parameter**<span offset-key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15:4"> or </span>**argument**<span offset-key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15:6">, to </span>`print()`<span offset-key="b5239a609b70452a94330c153596fa15:8">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="895db68431e145fd97d05d18591254aa"><span offset-key="895db68431e145fd97d05d18591254aa:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8433001b548e4f069547f241ec039c94"><span offset-key="8433001b548e4f069547f241ec039c94:0">Now let’s get back to what we wanted to do, which is to print </span>`5 * 6 = 30`<span offset-key="8433001b548e4f069547f241ec039c94:2">. The most basic version would be something of this kind, </span>`print("5 * 6 =                                                       30")`<span offset-key="8433001b548e4f069547f241ec039c94:4">. Here, we are passing the entire value in the form of a string.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="49bb8d904de24a4991aa585af40603ca"><span offset-key="49bb8d904de24a4991aa585af40603ca:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="110052eeadae49cf8e520dfdb9190c7d"><span offset-key="110052eeadae49cf8e520dfdb9190c7d:0">&gt;&gt; print("5 \* 6 = 30") 5 \* 6 = 30</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="bd2cac60488d4b72b16655a8609bd638"><span offset-key="bd2cac60488d4b72b16655a8609bd638:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91"><span offset-key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91:0">This prints the text on the console, as-is. The thing you need to understand here is, we aren’t really calculating </span>`30`<span offset-key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91:2"> using the formula </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91:4">, but directly putting text </span>`30`<span offset-key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91:6"> in here. That’s called </span>**hard-coding**<span offset-key="845feb2f2f9c4f529b773be0ad8a0d91:8">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b9a4dbea9dfa42a1ad00b170c6add2e6"><span offset-key="b9a4dbea9dfa42a1ad00b170c6add2e6:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="581669c5f3bd499aa2e0074f4eb1af69"><span offset-key="581669c5f3bd499aa2e0074f4eb1af69:0">In a later step, we will look at how to actually calculate the value and pass it in.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8c523ef775044499973d9a8ed653145a"><span offset-key="8c523ef775044499973d9a8ed653145a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="d357f514a9b946e791470db1cd6a59ca">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="2c21ba0f3ba24119a5eb4e5e4b1ec1af"><span offset-key="2c21ba0f3ba24119a5eb4e5e4b1ec1af:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="697b213c40e44bfbbac24a214fe655ea"><span offset-key="697b213c40e44bfbbac24a214fe655ea:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ea308869d613469da917fc415dc0f609"><span offset-key="ea308869d613469da917fc415dc0f609:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="d4ca8bce0c8a40b8be3071770871bb65"><span offset-key="d4ca8bce0c8a40b8be3071770871bb65:0">Understood that displaying text on the console is not the same as printing an expression value</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="3dd2284468814666a1b5dc4a2f11757d"><span offset-key="3dd2284468814666a1b5dc4a2f11757d:0">Learned about the </span>`print()`<span offset-key="3dd2284468814666a1b5dc4a2f11757d:2"> function, that is used to print text in Python.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="63b3fc9bf55a414ab6fb673ac216c5de"><span offset-key="63b3fc9bf55a414ab6fb673ac216c5de:0">Found a way to print the text </span>`"5 * 6 =                                                       30"`<span offset-key="63b3fc9bf55a414ab6fb673ac216c5de:2"> on the console, by hard-coding values in a string</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1fa24d49667747929e07a5ac34972708"><span offset-key="1fa24d49667747929e07a5ac34972708:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a2f784ad578b437387459623df64325b">**Step 07: Puzzles On Utility Methods, And Strings**</span>
>
>     <span key="13165a6398754072b9af8ac672714ddc"><span offset-key="13165a6398754072b9af8ac672714ddc:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="74c21700c2e64a8684a2d445386b2403"><span offset-key="74c21700c2e64a8684a2d445386b2403:0">In the previous step, we learned how to print </span>`5 * 6 = 30`<span offset-key="74c21700c2e64a8684a2d445386b2403:2">. It was not a perfect solution, because we hard-coded everything. we used an in-built function named </span>`print()`<span offset-key="74c21700c2e64a8684a2d445386b2403:4">, passed a string to it, and invoked the method.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="551826d5cac543f1b730b6fb7438e3fd"><span offset-key="551826d5cac543f1b730b6fb7438e3fd:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="db1f76fb016b4c849b2845266e5c3300"><span offset-key="db1f76fb016b4c849b2845266e5c3300:0">In this step, let’s look at a number of puzzles related to in-built methods, their parameters, and strings in general.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="36a5cda6efec4581abb705ee677d0e61"><span offset-key="36a5cda6efec4581abb705ee677d0e61:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="cebd2b5394ed494483a322c5922ac660"><span offset-key="cebd2b5394ed494483a322c5922ac660:0">For example, let’s do </span>`print("5 *                                                       6")`<span offset-key="cebd2b5394ed494483a322c5922ac660:2">, as in the previous step. What does this code result in?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="b43d4e114a3948f19ce5ae7130e7f88a"><span offset-key="b43d4e114a3948f19ce5ae7130e7f88a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="5e3fd2a271fc4030bd193ee86c71b837"><span offset-key="5e3fd2a271fc4030bd193ee86c71b837:0">&gt;&gt; print("5\*6") 5\*6 >&gt;&gt; print('5\*6') 5\*6</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="0f5254ded2994b1b8a2569ef201b4038"><span offset-key="0f5254ded2994b1b8a2569ef201b4038:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8fbd33b1e0c3435b95be9bd3442df075"><span offset-key="8fbd33b1e0c3435b95be9bd3442df075:0">It just prints the string </span>`"5 * 6"`<span offset-key="8fbd33b1e0c3435b95be9bd3442df075:2">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f86b56954d654412b919ff5b351b18bb"><span offset-key="f86b56954d654412b919ff5b351b18bb:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="fb35f1749739450da49ca816f40827b3"><span offset-key="fb35f1749739450da49ca816f40827b3:0">Let’s say we try the code </span>`print(5 * 6)`<span offset-key="fb35f1749739450da49ca816f40827b3:2">,</span></span>
>
>     <span key="74919150a85047c8b28b8c63736a3778"><span offset-key="74919150a85047c8b28b8c63736a3778:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="126c9a899dd348b6aa2ea55944073ae3"><span offset-key="126c9a899dd348b6aa2ea55944073ae3:0">&gt;&gt; print(5\*6) 30</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="314ba9ed65854e5899c578436644d1ea"><span offset-key="314ba9ed65854e5899c578436644d1ea:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="23116d908b014de98257dfb584a191b5"><span offset-key="23116d908b014de98257dfb584a191b5:0">Without the double quotes, </span>`5 * 6`<span offset-key="23116d908b014de98257dfb584a191b5:2"> is an expression. What will be the output? </span>`30`<span offset-key="23116d908b014de98257dfb584a191b5:4">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="20db9a36d59b449aba454f89486a9294"><span offset-key="20db9a36d59b449aba454f89486a9294:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ce79c385ba4444ee8f7fd03abb9522aa"><span offset-key="ce79c385ba4444ee8f7fd03abb9522aa:0">If you call </span>`print()`<span offset-key="ce79c385ba4444ee8f7fd03abb9522aa:2"> with an expression argument, it prints the value of the expression. However, when we pass something within double quotes, it becomes a piece of text, printed as-is.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6e046025f6154ac5b36b957386637008"><span offset-key="6e046025f6154ac5b36b957386637008:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e"><span offset-key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e:0">An interesting thing to note is, that in Python you can use either double-quotes (</span>`"`<span offset-key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e:2"> and </span>`"`<span offset-key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e:4">), or single-quotes (</span>`'`<span offset-key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e:6"> and </span>`'`<span offset-key="6ddd98749fb64ef98998c230728d015e:8">) with text values.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="2e9b32be9f9240e4bee0859e8c8afa8d"><span offset-key="2e9b32be9f9240e4bee0859e8c8afa8d:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="eefd562e78804659ac5a0b0ca18048d1"><span offset-key="eefd562e78804659ac5a0b0ca18048d1:0">Let’s look at a few other in-built methods within Python.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a208b767935e4211b419c40be18b6bd1"><span offset-key="a208b767935e4211b419c40be18b6bd1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3"><span offset-key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3:0">Consider </span>`abs()`<span offset-key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3:2"> (which stands for absolute value), a method that accepts a numeric value. You can use </span>`abs(10.5)`<span offset-key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3:4">, passing </span>`10.5`<span offset-key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3:6"> as a value to it, and it prints the absolute value of </span>`10`<span offset-key="a37770b8aa714181a5bad3d78c60edf3:8">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5e4e4e4128cd472c9ba4c1557fe04415"><span offset-key="5e4e4e4128cd472c9ba4c1557fe04415:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="8029340f6e444eee8c61a23a71fa7eca"><span offset-key="8029340f6e444eee8c61a23a71fa7eca:0">&gt;&gt; abs 10.5 File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 abs 10.5 ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax >&gt;&gt; abs(10.5) 10.5</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="79072e2ebcec408fa5242a731ca9535e"><span offset-key="79072e2ebcec408fa5242a731ca9535e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="af94ef7498814465b1cd171595446875"><span offset-key="af94ef7498814465b1cd171595446875:0">If you pass in a string value, will it work? It complains, “</span>`abs()`<span offset-key="af94ef7498814465b1cd171595446875:2"> function will not work with a string, it only works with numeric values”.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9017750538974b00982a15f135984415"><span offset-key="9017750538974b00982a15f135984415:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="149aae90c1d943419612aea3937d9db5"><span offset-key="149aae90c1d943419612aea3937d9db5:0">&gt;&gt; abs("10.5") Traceback (most recent call last): File "&lt;stdin>", line 1, in &lt;module> TypeError: bad operand type for abs(): 'str'</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="d858d9895c3048aba83a9767d7021879"><span offset-key="d858d9895c3048aba83a9767d7021879:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0"><span offset-key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0:0">Let’s say you want to use a function that computes “to the power of”, for instance “</span>`2`<span offset-key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0:2"> to the power of </span>`5`<span offset-key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0:4">”. In Python, there’s an in-built function named </span>`pow()`<span offset-key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0:6">, which does just what we need. To </span>`pow()`<span offset-key="2c5191f7479a44a4931a6d13ab45b3d0:8">, you can pass two parameters and calculate the result. How do you do that?</span></span>
>
>     <span key="3f39952400db4fe08b58018004cc323f"><span offset-key="3f39952400db4fe08b58018004cc323f:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="85549a53ad2947d6848318206f988593"><span offset-key="85549a53ad2947d6848318206f988593:0">Will this work: </span>`pow 2 5`<span offset-key="85549a53ad2947d6848318206f988593:2">? No, not at all. This code does not work as well: </span>`pow(2 5)`<span offset-key="85549a53ad2947d6848318206f988593:4">. </span>`pow(2, 5)`<span offset-key="85549a53ad2947d6848318206f988593:6"> is the correct syntax.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="81b5cb0283f9404097e4e358cd3f5594"><span offset-key="81b5cb0283f9404097e4e358cd3f5594:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="a88798a71e904cd0a2fbc46d7019f19c"><span offset-key="a88798a71e904cd0a2fbc46d7019f19c:0">&gt;&gt; pow 2 5 File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 pow 2 5 ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax >&gt;&gt; pow(2 5) File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 pow(2 5) ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax >&gt;&gt; pow(2, 5) 32</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="e454a369fef944f58f8e81d416236f42"><span offset-key="e454a369fef944f58f8e81d416236f42:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="87c428e51f924e4aae5a6a9e7a393ea1"><span offset-key="87c428e51f924e4aae5a6a9e7a393ea1:0">You’ll see that </span>`32`<span offset-key="87c428e51f924e4aae5a6a9e7a393ea1:2"> is printed.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8de89cd20998437e87c7711781bab4b6"><span offset-key="8de89cd20998437e87c7711781bab4b6:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192"><span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:0">Let’s see another example, “</span>`10`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:2"> to the power of </span>`3`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:4">”. </span>`pow(10,3)`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:6"> is the alternative to saying </span>`10 ** 3`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:8">. This gives us </span>`1000`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:10">, similar to how </span>`pow()`<span offset-key="2651a1e0c86d4977b564baf7995f0192:12"> would.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f056b6ccf00c402283ca909b4f29b072"><span offset-key="f056b6ccf00c402283ca909b4f29b072:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="0226d44328104df18b731f96ca9ea730"><span offset-key="0226d44328104df18b731f96ca9ea730:0">&gt;&gt; pow(10, 3) 1000 >&gt;&gt; 10 \*\* 3 1000</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="ac69105266474595802f1d1ea3d6b3b0"><span offset-key="ac69105266474595802f1d1ea3d6b3b0:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f40ee9992cfe4162b5c943a8359edae7">`max()`<span offset-key="f40ee9992cfe4162b5c943a8359edae7:1"> returns maximum in a set of numbers.</span>`min()`<span offset-key="f40ee9992cfe4162b5c943a8359edae7:3"> function returns the minimum value.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="18d3f0fa7f7d4f9aab3eaa11c7029540"><span offset-key="18d3f0fa7f7d4f9aab3eaa11c7029540:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="3dbf2b7e4e4a4438b9582c040f86cc92"><span offset-key="3dbf2b7e4e4a4438b9582c040f86cc92:0">&gt;&gt; max(34, 45, 67) 67 >&gt;&gt; min(34, 45, 67) 34</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="3ab7ab3cd2bf4f85b5fb726d68364041"><span offset-key="3ab7ab3cd2bf4f85b5fb726d68364041:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9a57857ff09944ac84e0a6a1dc4b3fa0"><span offset-key="9a57857ff09944ac84e0a6a1dc4b3fa0:0">These are some of the in-built functions in Python, and we saw how to call the in-built functions by passing in a varied number of parameters.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4adc6b5d80014e5484640fc0ee620563"><span offset-key="4adc6b5d80014e5484640fc0ee620563:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8"><span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:0">Python is case sensitive. So let’s say I want of calculate </span>`pow(2,5)`<span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:2">. So this would give me </span>`32`<span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:4">. Now, what if I say capital </span>`'P'`<span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:6"> instead of small </span>`'p'`<span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:8"> here? </span>`Pow(2,5)`<span offset-key="9fe3f6818b264514a3d42af61015d3a8:10"> would lead to an error.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="3775271b13524507a92c108d8e5d4be3"><span offset-key="3775271b13524507a92c108d8e5d4be3:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="3c1e98dce291415e8626efeb1333be11"><span offset-key="3c1e98dce291415e8626efeb1333be11:0">&gt;&gt; pow(2,5) 32 >&gt;&gt; Pow(2,5) Traceback (most recent call last): File "&lt;stdin>", line 1, in &lt;module> NameError: name 'Pow' is not defined</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="67ad3c9d7c8b4281b67820560672bbeb"><span offset-key="67ad3c9d7c8b4281b67820560672bbeb:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559"><span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:0">The only things not case-sensitive in Python, are string values. Earlier we saw that the code </span>`print("Hello")`<span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:2"> displays the text </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:4">. Inside a string, the text can be in any case. Hence, </span>`print("hello")`<span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:6"> displays </span>`"hello"`<span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:8"> ,with a small </span>`'h'`<span offset-key="5be8b6ee1db2402aa46b070c8f47d559:10">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ce6bfc90cab546d7902ea2e56aa5ca9a"><span offset-key="ce6bfc90cab546d7902ea2e56aa5ca9a:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="1d51447ff1594487890d7677ad8bbd98"><span offset-key="1d51447ff1594487890d7677ad8bbd98:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello") Hello >&gt;&gt; print("hello") hello >&gt;&gt; print("hellO") hellO >&gt;&gt; print ( "hellO" ) hellO</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="ef8b9ff527c54c3bb5fa61317e8fab73"><span offset-key="ef8b9ff527c54c3bb5fa61317e8fab73:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4d63da49a8cb4ae3b5aa1115e99d39d5"><span offset-key="4d63da49a8cb4ae3b5aa1115e99d39d5:0">However inside your code, you need to be very particular about the case of function names, class names, variable names, and the like.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="d28faec4f32044c3a41786b3bfff34c1"><span offset-key="d28faec4f32044c3a41786b3bfff34c1:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="76466ffe255f4463877eed40ef37e4fe"><span offset-key="76466ffe255f4463877eed40ef37e4fe:0">In your code, whitespace does not really matter. You can add space here and here, and you would still get the same output. However, in case of strings, whitespace does matter.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4fd4a2ea1bc0442a95d2f1c9cb6fc1a5"><span offset-key="4fd4a2ea1bc0442a95d2f1c9cb6fc1a5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="726454beef9b4527b824ea60b73936c1"><span offset-key="726454beef9b4527b824ea60b73936c1:0">If we say </span>`print("hellO                                                       World")`<span offset-key="726454beef9b4527b824ea60b73936c1:2">, it would print </span>`"hellO                                                       World"`<span offset-key="726454beef9b4527b824ea60b73936c1:4">, with a space in between. And if you do </span>`print("hellO                                                       World")`<span offset-key="726454beef9b4527b824ea60b73936c1:6"> with three spaces, it would print the same. In expressions, white-space does not affect the output.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="1134269601614162a947bd7546c190bf"><span offset-key="1134269601614162a947bd7546c190bf:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="74896930b1ba459986c603c8334ed92e"><span offset-key="74896930b1ba459986c603c8334ed92e:0">&gt;&gt; print ( "hellO World" ) hellO World >&gt;&gt; print ( "hellO World" ) hellO World</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="5eefceaf0917448c9dd63fa262f2e6e5"><span offset-key="5eefceaf0917448c9dd63fa262f2e6e5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f53e589de3ae4409815be7da59903a84"><span offset-key="f53e589de3ae4409815be7da59903a84:0">The last thing we want to look at, is an </span>**escape sequence**<span offset-key="f53e589de3ae4409815be7da59903a84:2">. Let’s say you want to print a double quote, </span>`"`<span offset-key="f53e589de3ae4409815be7da59903a84:4">, in the code. If we were to do this: </span>`print("Hello"")`<span offset-key="f53e589de3ae4409815be7da59903a84:6">, what would happen? The compiler says error!</span></span>
>
>     <span key="a3d8c00a293b4503954eeee8650f52cd"><span offset-key="a3d8c00a293b4503954eeee8650f52cd:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="f8b7686cccaf45a588cd36521024cfdd"><span offset-key="f8b7686cccaf45a588cd36521024cfdd:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello"") File "&lt;stdin>", line 1 print("Hello"") ^ SyntaxError: EOL while scanning string literal</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="e21c518dac13452eb0d94128cd2f344e"><span offset-key="e21c518dac13452eb0d94128cd2f344e:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db"><span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:0">If you want to print a </span>`"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:2"> inside a string, use an escape sequence. In Python, the symbol </span>`'\'`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:4"> is used as an </span>**escape character**<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:6">. On using </span>`'\'`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:8"> adjacent to the </span>`"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:10">, it prints </span>`Hello"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:12"> (notice the trailing </span>`"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:14">). We have used the </span>`'\'`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:16"> to </span>**escape**<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:18"> the </span>`"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:20">, by forming an </span>*escape sequence*<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:22"> </span>`\"`<span offset-key="4fef941538b047b2aaeaa32a0c0a47db:24">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="f4648911fec74572b240e2f870bdddb4"><span offset-key="f4648911fec74572b240e2f870bdddb4:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="7161f06124ee46c380cd8711930e0fc6"><span offset-key="7161f06124ee46c380cd8711930e0fc6:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\"")Hello">&gt;&gt;</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="58cf038de61847248662916eab6ea494"><span offset-key="58cf038de61847248662916eab6ea494:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35"><span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:0">The other reason why you would want to use a </span>`'\'`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:2"> is to print a </span>`<NEWLINE>`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:4">. If you want to print </span>`"Hello                                                       World"`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:6">, but with </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:8"> on one line and </span>`"World"`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:10"> on the next, </span>`'\n'`<span offset-key="24fa83a587b94abd82ee9e5deb63cb35:12"> is the escape sequence to use.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="d02c4ba614614134bd9b991d319108a5"><span offset-key="d02c4ba614614134bd9b991d319108a5:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="9debb9e64d224fa0b6e0474518be8619"><span offset-key="9debb9e64d224fa0b6e0474518be8619:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\nWorld") Hello World</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="7ff1f0fc5b8d4b7281106c1c057f77ee"><span offset-key="7ff1f0fc5b8d4b7281106c1c057f77ee:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43"><span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:0">The other important escape sequence is </span>`'\t'`<span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:2">, which prints a </span>`<TAB>`<span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:4"> in the output. When you do </span>`print("Hello\tWorld")`<span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:6">, you can see the tab-space between </span>`"Hello"`<span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:8"> and </span>`"World"`<span offset-key="6f161807eaf14b57a3baca1bf0536a43:10">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="8fd49cbd9a434e08ba83574801fd71fd"><span offset-key="8fd49cbd9a434e08ba83574801fd71fd:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="7c0edcedb01e4373b0b4a06bdd0acc6a"><span offset-key="7c0edcedb01e4373b0b4a06bdd0acc6a:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\tWorld") Hello World</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="9884c79b079a4fa09dce12b968165cdd"><span offset-key="9884c79b079a4fa09dce12b968165cdd:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8"><span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:0">Another useful escape sequence is </span>`\\`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:2"> . If you want to print a </span>`\`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:4"> , then use the sequence </span>`\\`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:6"> . You would see that it prints </span>`Hello\World`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:8"> . Think about what would happen if we put six </span>`\`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:10"> . Yes you’re right! It would print this string: </span>`"\\\"`<span offset-key="c2b2a8f467bd414798fbdb53133795c8:12"> .</span></span>
>
>     <span key="88aab93ed92f47589f4675f1c79034f4"><span offset-key="88aab93ed92f47589f4675f1c79034f4:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="259717a23299476eaed0e73c9cadf83f"><span offset-key="259717a23299476eaed0e73c9cadf83f:0">&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\\\World") Hello\\World >&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\\\\\\\\\\\World") Hello\\\\\\World</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="c828ca8287c549caa63ec86101fe349c"><span offset-key="c828ca8287c549caa63ec86101fe349c:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="4ba495f924d5452aaadd56f0cd5d63d3"><span offset-key="4ba495f924d5452aaadd56f0cd5d63d3:0">One of the things with Python is, it does not matter whether you use double quotes or single quotes to enclose strings. There are some interesting, and useful ways of using a combination of both, within the same string. Have a look at this call: </span>`print("Hello'World")`<span offset-key="4ba495f924d5452aaadd56f0cd5d63d3:2">, and notice the output we get. In a similar way, the following code will be accepted and run by the Python system: </span>`print('Hello"World')`<span offset-key="4ba495f924d5452aaadd56f0cd5d63d3:4">.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="ccf3a584a4004b4d9725efa070d4f836"><span offset-key="ccf3a584a4004b4d9725efa070d4f836:0">​</span></span>
>
>     1
>
>     <span key="707d8f1c30004189a3514892ce7cdaa6"><span offset-key="707d8f1c30004189a3514892ce7cdaa6:0">&gt;&gt; print('Hello"') Hello" >&gt;&gt; print("Hello'World") Hello'World >&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\"World") Hello"World >&gt;&gt; print("Hello\\"World") Hello"World</span></span>
>
>     <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     Copied!
>
>     <span key="fdd14bf2297c4093b563de129f31122d"><span offset-key="fdd14bf2297c4093b563de129f31122d:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c172dbe606344ea6b180e4d558dc66e8"><span offset-key="c172dbe606344ea6b180e4d558dc66e8:0">The above two examples can be used as a tip by newbie programmers when they form string literals, and want to use them in their code:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c5529bec9f3c4c7baac27ef76c1a694a"><span offset-key="c5529bec9f3c4c7baac27ef76c1a694a:0">​</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="95cf80efc4114ce59cc20d16f8ffef48"><span offset-key="95cf80efc4114ce59cc20d16f8ffef48:0">If the string literal contains one or more single quotes, then you can use double quotes to enclose it.</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="340c0583cdc0497e9b47433e4f16cfcb"><span offset-key="340c0583cdc0497e9b47433e4f16cfcb:0">However if the string contains one or more double quotes, then prefer to use single quotes to enclose it.</span></span>
>
>     <span key="c80816562df94e68937ccda20070b377"><span offset-key="c80816562df94e68937ccda20070b377:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="9e7a5e72d6794318af43b235b3c56558">**Summary**</span>
>
>     <span key="5637b64eeeb8491ba2b360cf2ea6a145"><span offset-key="5637b64eeeb8491ba2b360cf2ea6a145:0">​</span></span>
>
>     <span key="df0e5b163f694b7e9ea0b6fe6098712a"><span offset-key="df0e5b163f694b7e9ea0b6fe6098712a:0">In this step, we:</span></span>
>
>     <span key="03c335ebef9a4037a52114312107e70d"><span offset-key="03c335ebef9a4037a52114312107e70d:0">​</span></span>
>

>
>     <span key="4f87f31c9a6245338b2a89b9c3d02bea"><span offset-key="4f87f31c9a6245338b2a89b9c3d02bea:0">Explored a number of puzzles related to code involving:</span></span>
>
>     -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         <span key="6e546d4c57944d208c68e61814c5062b"><span offset-key="6e546d4c57944d208c68e61814c5062b:0">Built-in functions for numeric calculations</span></span>
>
>     -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>         <span key="629a042d626f496d92237be04c551032"><span offset-key="629a042d626f496d92237be04c551032:0">The </span>`print()`<span offset-key="629a042d626f496d92237be04c551032:2"> function to display expressions and strings</span></span>
>
> -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
>
>     <span key="a14ab5bc52bc4cd2834e9532f89f5421"><span offset-key="a14ab5bc52bc4cd2834e9532f89f5421:0">Covered the following aspects of the above utilities:</span></span>
>
>     -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

>
>     -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />
